intro: Saussurea dutaillyana var. macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed saussurea, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers, which bloom in late summer, are often yellow or brown and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
